dialog-modal-model-creation.html.source:
{{title}}

You can not directly create a model.

To create a model, you have to create a schema and then a model will be generated based on your schema definition.

dialog-modal-component-info.html.source:
{{title}}

By default all your models inherit from _Component. It adds to your models a set of APIs to:

- manage your components,

- add/remove listeners to components events and

- require components.

You can remove this inheritance for your needs.

documentation-overview.html.source:
What is System Designer ?

Design is the base of every app. System Designer will help you to create JavaScript Application Systems, applications driven by the design.

With System Designer, you focus first on your model and then on your code.

Features:

  • No file-system: focus on your business logic and not on the structure of your project. Your entire project is stored in a NoSQL DB and it can be exported in a single JSON object.
  • Hot-reload: Updating your application in System Designer will automatically update your connected app. You do not need to reload your app to see your latests modifications.
  • Remote designing: get the model, behaviors and components of all running apps and update them live.
  • Module builder: your HTML or CSS can be required in your app.

System Designer is part of the System SDK project.

What is System SDK ?

System SDK project is a SDK for building JavaScript Application Systems. It contains:

  • System Designer, a UI designer to create JavaScript Application Systems and
  • Runtime, a JavaScript library to run and manage JavaScript Application Systems.

System SDK Architecture

  • System Designer can create a JSON that represents an application and
  • Runtime can run an application from this JSON.
  1. Documentation
  2. Overview

documentation-quick-start.html.source:
In this quick start, we will:

  • create a system,
  • run it client side
  • and server side.

Create a system

  • click on the + button on the left toolbar,
  • set StarWars as name,
  • a new system is now created and appears in the Systems list.

Create a schema

  • click on the Schema tab,
  • click on the + button on the left toolbar,
  • set Jedi as name,
  • a new schema is now created and appears in the Schemas list,
  • click on it,
  • update the MSON with this:
{

  "_id": "1e378193da16eef",

  "_name": "Jedi",

  "_inherit": [

    "_Component"

  ],

  "firstName": "property",

  "lastName": "property",

  "father": "link",

  "fullName": "method"

}
  • save.

Use property for creating a property.
Use link for creating a link between models.
Use collection for creating a collection.
Use method for creating a method.
Use event for creating an event.

A model will be automatically generated based on the informations you set in the schema.

Add a behavior

  • click on the Models tab,
  • click on fullName method,
  • you navigate to the Behavior context,
  • click on fullName element,
  • update the code with this:
function fullName(param) {

  var result = this.firstName() + ' ' + this.lastName();

  return result;

}
  • save.

Create components

  • click on the Components tab,
  • select Jedi on right,
  • click on the + button on the left toolbar,
  • a new component is now created and appears in the Components list,
  • click on it,
  • update the JSON with this:
{

  "_id": "13331191e31d2d0",

  "father": {},

  "firstName": "Dark",

  "lastName": "Vador"

}
  • save.
  • click on the + button on the left toolbar,
  • a new component is now created and appears in the Components list,
  • click on it,
  • update the JSON with this:
{

  "_id": "166c21e4a01dd30",

  "father": "13331191e31d2d0",

  "firstName": "Luke",

  "lastName": "Skywalker"

}
  • save.

Add code on the main method of the system

  • click on the Behaviors tab,
  • click on StarWars on the right list,
  • click on the element who has got 'main' as name,
  • update the code with this:
function main() {

     var luke = null,

         logger = null;

 

     // get the component

     luke = this.require('166c21e4a01dd30');

 
   
  // get the name of the father of Luke

     logger = this.require('logger');

     logger.debug(luke.father().fullName());

 }
  • save.

Test the system

  • click on the run button on the left of toolbar,
  • lick on the Logs tab and you will see the result.

Run your system client side

  • click on the export button,
  • select HTML,
  • your system will be exported in a HTML file,
  • load the page.

Run your system server side

  • click on the export button,
  • select JS (Node.js),
  • your system will be exported in a JavaScript file,
  • save the file on your server project,
  • in your project, install this package to run your system:
npm install system-runtime --save
  • run your system:
node StarWars.js
  1. Documentation
  2. Quick Start

export-app-github.html.source:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>

<head>
    <title>{{name}}</title>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <!-- system -->
    <link rel="system" type="application/json" href="{{name}}.json">
</head>

<body>
    <!-- System Runtime  -->
    <script log="{{logLevel}}" src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/system-runtime@2.0.0-alpha.5/dist/system-runtime.min.js"></script>
</body>

</html>

export-app.html.source:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>

<head>
    <title>{{name}}</title>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
</head>

<body>
    <!-- System Runtime -->
    <script>
{{library}}
    </script>
    <!-- system -->
    <script>
    runtime.on('ready', function ready() {
        // set the level of log
        this.require('logger').level('{{logLevel}}');
        // install and start the system
        this.install({{system}});
    }, false, true);
    </script>
</body>

</html>

help-behaviors.html.source: A behavior is the action to do when a method or an event is called.

help-components.html.source: Components are the store of your objects.

help-logs.html.source:
You will find here the logs of the running app.

Example of log:

this
.require('logger')
.info('hello world');

help-models.html.source: A model is an UML representation of your classes.

help-schemas.html.source: A schema is the definition of your model. Models are generated based on the schema definition.

help-system.html.source: An application is a system. Once you have created one, your next step is to create a schema.

help-types.html.source: A type is used in your model to define an enumeration or a structure.
